sense.name: lift, go up
sense.examples: We saw smoke rising in the distance. The building rose before them When the water boils, bubbles will rise to the surface. They believed the sun would rise in another hour.

sense.name: increase, advance
sense.examples: The value of our house rose sharply last year. Tensions were rising at that meeting. The thermometer is rising. He has risen through the ranks to become a director at his firm. Demand for oil has been rising steadily during the last decade. His second album rose to number three on the charts in just two weeks. A glass of good wine will make your spirits rise!

sense.name: change posture
sense.examples: We rose to our feet and applauded as she came onstage. He rises before dawn every day to work out at the gym. Try rising from a sitting position without using your arms.

sense.name: expand physically
sense.examples: The dough will rise more quickly in a warm, dark place. The souffle didn't seem to rise very much in the oven.

sense.name: act, confront
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent] RISE (UP) PP Includes: RISE UP
sense.examples: John was able to rise to the new challenges facing him. The peasants rose against the evil king.

sense.name: originate, develop
sense.examples: The theme of that play rose from his wartime experiences. A sense of dread began to rise in his heart.

sense.name: return
sense.examples: The Phoenix rose from his ashes. The South shall rise again! Christ has risen!
